data.title: Ate there once so far and it was good.
data.text: I had a burger and a shake.  The burger was very good, but the strawberry shake for some reason was exceptional.

data.title: Great Burgers
data.text: We came here for dinner. The food here is of excellent quality - great burgers, fries - the basics but very tasty!  Very friendly service, good prices, great beer selection, outdoor patio.

data.title: Quality
data.text: Excellent burgers, excellent staff, no cut corners.  If you've had the privilege of trying Village Burger on the Big Island of Hawaii, this is the closest I've seen on the mainland.

data.title: Real beef
data.text: My family has been on a quest to find the best burger.  Feed Co. ranks right up there in my book.  The beef had good flavor and texture, a little pink in the middle, and juicy.  This is not like the typical chain prefab patty.  The standard, lettuce, tomato, pickle were fresh.  The sauce was not excessive and complemented the beef.  The fries were good.  The onion rings were large and crispy but the onions were a little tough.  One person in our group had a chocolate shake and she liked it.

data.title: Real Beef - Real Milkshakes - Quality Organic Foods
data.text:
This is a funky neighborhood burgers, salads and others restaurant.
All ingredients are sourced locally and are fresh, very tasty and organic.
Other restaurants have to drown their food in sauces to make them tasty but Feed Company foods are really tasty before you season them or add sauces.
Milkshakes are made from Snoqualmie Valley Ice cream made from real milk and has great flavor. Add in a little malt and rich Ghirardelli chocolate syrup and it's a shake as you remember them as a kid (before chemical additives).
Fries are tasty and if you love truffles then the truffle fries are heaven.
The staff are very friendly, attentive and aim to please.
You pay more than mass production restaurants but it is well worth it.
3 Thumbs Up !

data.title: Good burger
data.text: The Blue Onion burger was a great choice. It was filled with large chunks of blue cheese and onions. Their fried cheese curds were crispy yet very satisfying. The seating was casual yet inviting and clean. Would definitely visit again.

data.title: FEED me
data.text:
Fun Anniversary dinner at Feedco in Redmond. I had one of the specials the "Spicy Lamb-burger"...with Devine cremola sauce, mild chilles, sautéed onions, arugula and tempura fried lemons...the best!
The tempura fried  lemons on top of the brioche roll was a yummy surprise. I love lamb burgers and order them whenever I get a chance: haven't had one this DELICIOUS. My husband had a "regular"bacon cheese burger which he rated high as well, especially liked the fresh Raspberry milkshake. We'll definitely be back!

data.title: Very good burger and rings.  Good milkshakes
data.text: We have stopped in many times and the burgers are always top notch.  We also enjoy the sweet potato fries but especially love the onion rings.  They also offer salads if someone is looking for a lighter fare.  The milkshakes are thick and tasty and always come with a little extra in the mixing cup.  The only issue I have with the restaurant is the ordering process.  It is too slow and cumbersome. Never seems to be enough cashiers or order takers.  Will be back but will stop in at ofttimes when service will be quicker.  The staff is always friendly and quick to fix simple mistakes upon food delivery.

data.title: A great burger at a good price
data.text: We stopped here in need of a quicker lunch at a reasonable price. I am always on the look out for a good burger so this was a great stop. I got the basic $5 burger but there are many more options if you want something bigger and more adventurous. I did add on caramelized onions which were the best caramelized onions I have ever had on a burger. We also got some onion rings on the side. They were good- perhaps a little underseasoned. On my next visit I will be sure to try one of their many side sauces you can order.

data.title: Shakes, burgers, fries, and cheese curds
data.text: Everything we ordered was very good, we had the salted caramel shake (they give you the extra in the stainless steel mixing container), the BIM burger, the Baja burger, fries and cheese curds. My only small wish is that the fries and cheese curds came with a dipping sauce.

data.title: Best Burgers, Fries and Beer in Redmond
data.text: Fresh, made to order burgers and fries or onion rings. Paired up with a great list of awesome beers.

data.title: Best Burger in Redmond
data.text: I Iove this burger place. The burgers are amazing.  I love the fries and onion rings. It is great place for families. They have good milkshakes.

data.title: Casual but awesome burgers
data.text: Big, individually made, high quality burgers. What more can you want?  We share a side because they are very generous portions.  The cheese curds with some Siracha are yummy.  The milkshakes are thick and creamy but not so thick you can't actually suck them through the straw.  Loved their buffalo chicken burger too.

data.title: Nicely crafted burgers and good beverage selection
data.text: While the service can be a bit slow due to counter ordering only, the food is worth the wait.  Freshly food cooked to order along with fries, onion rings, sweet potato fries are offered as sides. Lots of local brews as well as hand made milkshakes are available aside from soft drinks.  A few salad offerings fill out the menu.  Burgers and other hot offerings including some bison chicken and fish  served hot fresh and delicious.  Look forward to returning.

data.title: Good burgers
data.text: Small, informal, gourmet burger joint. I like the layout and the decor, nothing too fancy or cheap. Texicana Burger was delicious! My husband didn't like the bison burger but thought everything else was great. I thought the fries were a little too greasy but the shakes are awesome! We will be back :)

data.title: Great burger joint
data.text: This is purely a burger joint, and they do make some good burgers.  It's a fast sit down joint that uses local ingredients and is pretty tasty.

data.title: Great burger
data.text:
We stopped in just based on the signage, and it didn't disappoint. I had the Texicana burger and it was great. We tried both the regular fries and the sweet potato and both were very good, although we would have liked to have tried the onion rings and cheese curds. 

I wish I lived locally so I could sample more of the menu. Strongly recommended for foodies and burger aficionados.

data.title: Greasy but good!
data.text: Went to Feed Co for the first time last weekend.  Got the Bison and the Bleu with onion rings and sweet potato fries. The Bison was the better burger with more flavor and texture. The Bleu was overwhelmed by the cheese and you couldn't taste the beef. Onion rings were tasty but super greasy. Service and atmosphere reminded us of a hipster place in Portland, which is a funny thing to find in Redmond. Would go back again but would need to hit the gym the next morning to feel good about it.

data.title: Great Shakes & Floats!
data.text: Made-to-order burgers...simple & tasty.  Lots of options to customize your burger.  Great fries and onion rings!  The service was good and the restaurant was clean.  What we enjoyed most...the shakes and floats...made with real hand-dipped ice cream.

data.title: Excellent fast casual burger spot in downtown Redmond
data.text: Feed Co is a great location for a quick lunch.  The restaurant is not too large and can probably seat 35-40 people comfortably on a cold day.  During sunnier days there is a large outdoor seating area that can fit another 30-40 people.  But size does not matter here as the service is quick and the food is delicious.  Most of the clientele are business lunch customers from the surrounding area who are looking for a speedy bite to eat.  There are a lot of options ranging from standard burgers to seasonal fruit and vegetable options.  Along with some friends we have tried almost everything on the menu and been pleased with every item.
